headline: GE Aerospace Expands Singapore Engine Hub With Automation And AI Focus
summary: GE Aerospace, part of General Electric (NYSE:GE), announced a multi year, US$300 million investment in its engine repair facilities in Singapore. The plan focuses on expanding capacity and upgrading operations with more automation, digitization, and AI tools. The Singapore site is a key hub for engine repair serving airlines across the Asia Pacific region. For you as an investor, this move sits at the intersection of GE's aerospace focus and long running efforts across aviation to improve...

headline: Is GE HealthCare Technologies (GEHC) Offering Value After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: If you are wondering whether GE HealthCare Technologies is priced attractively right now or if the current share price already reflects its potential, this article walks you through what the numbers are saying about value. The stock last closed at US$82.58, with returns of 4.2% over the past week, a 2.9% decline over the last 30 days, a 0.3% decline year to date, and a 5.1% decline over the past year, while the 3 year return sits at 18.3%. headline: Is GE’s (GE) Singapore AI Bet Quietly Redefining Its Aerospace Services Moat?
summary: In early February 2026, GE Aerospace announced a multi-year plan to invest up to US$300 million from 2025 to 2029 to upgrade and expand its Singapore engine repair operations, incorporating advanced automation, digitization, and AI-enabled inspection technologies with support from the Singapore Economic Development Board. This move not only deepens GE Aerospace’s maintenance footprint in Asia-Pacific but also signals how AI, predictive maintenance, and new coating capabilities are becoming...
